meanings.definition: The quality or state of being virtual.
meanings.sent1: The virtualities of the online world allow for endless exploration.
meanings.sent2: She was fascinated by the virtualities of the video game environment.
meanings.sent3: The virtualities of the virtual reality game made her forget about the real world.
meanings.sent4: The virtualities of the digital realm seemed more vibrant than reality itself.
meanings.sent5: His imagination brought the virtualities of the story to life.

meanings.definition: The potential for something to become real or actual.
meanings.sent1: The virtualities of his dream becoming a reality excited him.
meanings.sent2: They discussed the virtualities of their business expanding globally.
meanings.sent3: The virtualities of winning the lottery seemed too good to be true.
meanings.sent4: The virtualities of success motivated her to work harder.
meanings.sent5: The virtualities of a peaceful world are worth striving for.

meanings.definition: The existence of something in essence or effect, though not in actual fact.
meanings.sent1: The virtualities of his presence were felt even when he was not there.
meanings.sent2: She pondered the virtualities of their relationship lasting forever.
meanings.sent3: The virtualities of a ghostly figure haunted the old mansion.
meanings.sent4: The virtualities of his promise lingered in her mind.
meanings.sent5: The virtualities of a parallel universe fascinated scientists.
